so_56841053: $ touch foo

touch -d

man touch

touch -t 201612051230 Downloads

Top-3 Similar Questions: so_36550101: How to change date format of data for each line in Unix?
ul_311186: Changing the date format of the file
ul_629270: Change date format with awk command only one first columns of the file
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_311186: awk -F '[[\\]]' '{cmd="date -d \""$2"\" \"+%F %T\""; cmd | getline out; print out $3}'

% cat file.txt
[Sat Sep 10 06:31:41 2016]!Node2!Node1!Node3
[Sun Sep 11 23:31:41 2016]!Node2!Node1!Node3

% awk -F '[[\\]]' '{cmd="date -d \""$2"\" \"+%F %T\""; cmd | getline out; print out $3}' file.txt
2016-09-10 06:31:41!Node2!Node1!Node3
2016-09-11 23:31:41!Node2!Node1!Node3
